title: Ticket #7608: Explicitly list source file in condor_utils CMakeLists
description:
The CMakeLIsts in condor_utils forms a list of source for libcondorutil by globbing all the files in the condor_utils directory, minus a blacklist. This requires developers to re-build cmake when a new file shows up, which they may not be aware of if it comes from someone else.

CMake best practice is to explicitly list all source files.

Also, all the source files in this directory are built twice -- once for the shared library version and once of the static version. Making things worse, many of the files are built four times -- static and shared for both libcondorutils and libcondorapi.

This change will explicitly list the files that go in just condorapi, just condorutils or both, and compile each one just once. As we already turn on -fPIC for all files, this should not be a problem.

Also, the same problem happens in the classad library, so we'll do the same trick there.
